intro: Arundarbor levis, commonly known as the silverleaf orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It features lance-shaped, silver-gray leaves with a waxy coating that helps reduce water loss in arid conditions. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its unique foliage and ornamental value make it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
